name: Traveler’s Tunic
description: Simple cloth garb for those always on the road. Offers minimal protection but full mobility.

name: Padded Gambeson
description: Thick quilted jacket worn under armor or alone. Some bulk, but warm and absorbent.

name: Leather Vest
description: Flexible boiled leather torso armor. Lightweight and silent.

name: Shadowweave Jerkin
description: Dark leather reinforced with alchemical thread. Favored by assassins.

name: Studded Jacket
description: Hardened leather embedded with iron studs. Clinks faintly when moving.

name: Bone Harness
description: Tribal armor of lacquered beast bones. Intimidating and ritualistic.

name: Lamellar Vest
description: Layered metal plates sewn into leather. Popular with eastern mercenaries.

name: Iron Chain Shirt
description: A common soldier’s armor. Good balance between protection and weight.

name: Elkhide Warcoat
description: Heavy hide coat reinforced with bone and fur. Often worn by barbarian clans.

name: Scale Hauberk
description: Metal scales riveted to leather backing. Clinks slightly in motion.

name: Runed Brigandine
description: Steel plates stitched inside an embroidered coat. Often bears noble insignia.

name: Half-Plate Cuirass
description: Chest and shoulder armor of forged steel. Leaves limbs lightly armored.

name: Wyvernscale Plating
description: Crafted from wyvern hide and scales. Resistant to heat and claws alike.

name: Mountain Guard Harness
description: Massive dwarven steel plates with integrated shoulder guards and backplate.

name: Knight’s Bastion Plate
description: Elite full-body plate polished to a shine. Worn by royal vanguards.

name: Blacksteel Shell
description: A matte, darkened armor of volcanic-forged steel. Heavy and imposing.

name: Frostbone Harness
description: Spiked armor of frozen beast bone and chill iron. Rare and brutal.

name: Sunforged Splintmail
description: Ornate armor forged in temple fires. Gleams with divine authority.

name: Witchguard Carapace
description: Armor built from resin and bone, often worn by cultists and forest witches.

name: Hedge Knight Harness
description: Patchwork armor made from scavenged pieces. Worn by wanderers and sellswords.

name: Dagger
description: A short blade favored by rogues and commoners alike.

name: Punch Dagger
description: A fist-mounted blade used for close-quarters assassinations.

name: Sickle
description: A farming tool turned weapon, favored by druids and revolutionaries.

name: Hand Axe
description: A versatile tool and weapon, can be thrown in combat.

name: Spiked Knuckles
description: Reinforced fist wraps that add deadly force to punches.

name: Shortsword
description: A straight, agile blade ideal for quick stabs and duels.

name: Mace
description: A solid metal club designed to crush armor and bones alike.

name: Battle Pick
description: A heavy miner's pick adapted for combat, punches through armor.

name: Warhammer
description: Used with one or two hands, devastating against armored foes.

name: Falchion
description: A heavy curved blade that cleaves through multiple targets.

name: Spear
description: A versatile weapon used for throwing or thrusting from a distance.

name: Greatclub
description: A massive two-handed club made of dense wood or stone.

name: Greataxe
description: A brutal axe for devastating overhead chops.

name: Glaive
description: A long polearm with a curved blade, allows sweeping reach attacks.

name: Halberd
description: Combines axe, spear, and hook into one fearsome weapon.

name: Maul
description: A massive hammer capable of shattering bones and barriers.

name: Fangblade
description: A ritual blade with twin jagged edges, favored by cultists.

name: Throwing Hammer
description: Balanced for throwing, yet solid enough for melee.

name: Chain Whip
description: A flexible chain tipped with blades, used to entangle and cut.

name: Obsidian Saber
description: Shatters easily but cuts with terrifying precision.

name: Shortbow
description: A compact, easily carried bow ideal for scouts and skirmishers.

name: Longbow
description: Tall and powerful, favored by elven archers and hunters.

name: Throwing Dagger
description: A perfectly balanced dagger made for distance precision.

name: Hand Crossbow
description: Small and concealable, popular among rogues and spies.

name: Light Crossbow
description: Reliable and powerful with slow reload speed.

name: Heavy Crossbow
description: Punches through armor at long range. Takes time to reload.

name: Sling
description: Simple but effective. Favored by halflings and peasants.

name: Chakrams
description: Circular throwing blades that slice through targets and spin back.

name: Boomerang
description: Curved wood used for sport or stunning foes.

name: Throwing Axe
description: A sharpened axe balanced for one-handed throwing.

name: Javelin
description: Spear-like projectile for hurling over distance.

name: Needle Rifle
description: Precision launcher that fires bone-thin darts with explosive pressure.

name: Alchemical Launcher
description: Lobs volatile concoctions. Explodes on impact.

name: Throwing Spear
description: Heavier than a javelin but capable of greater force.

name: Throwing Star
description: Silent, sharp, and difficult to see in flight.

name: Wristbow
description: Strapped to the wrist and fired with a flick. Concealable but weak.

name: Spitfire Tube
description: Fires a short burst of fire or acid. Requires recharging.

name: Skyhook Lance
description: Chain-attached spear that can yank enemies back.

name: Glider Disk
description: Wide-edged metal disc designed for gliding arcs.

name: Storm Sling
description: Blessed sling that crackles with energy on release.

name: Wax fluted Key
description: A fluted key made of wax. Common in roadside markets or looted from ruins.

name: Glass folding Key
description: A folding key made of glass. Common in roadside markets or looted from ruins.

name: Iron folding Key
description: A folding key made of iron. Common in roadside markets or looted from ruins.

name: Leather coiled Mask
description: A coiled mask made of leather. Common in roadside markets or looted from ruins.

name: Crystal hollow Disk
description: A hollow disk made of crystal. Common in roadside markets or looted from ruins.

name: Leather riveted Coin
description: A riveted coin made of leather. Common in roadside markets or looted from ruins.

description: A coiled pouch made of iron. Common in roadside markets or looted from ruins.

name: Tinderbox
description: Used to light torches, candles, and campfires.

name: Iron Pot
description: Heavy metal cooking pot, holds stew or boiling water.

name: Lantern, Hooded
description: Casts bright light in 30 ft. Can be shuttered.

name: Chalk (5 sticks)
description: Used to mark walls or floors. Essential for dungeoneering.

name: Spyglass (poor quality)
description: Distorts at long range, but helpful for scouting.

name: Wooden Idol
description: Carved likeness of a local god or nature spirit.

name: Puzzle Box
description: Intricate box requiring an INT check to open.

name: Glowstone Pebble
description: Radiates dim light for 1 hour when tapped.

name: Traveler’s Mirror
description: Steel-backed mirror useful for peeking around corners.

name: Spool of Red Thread
description: Unwinds up to 500 ft. Often used for mazes.
